posts.post_content: If you're against an Infect deck, this card is pure gold (she said as though it were not glaringly obvious). Sure, she needs protection from various types of removal, destruction, and direct damage, but so do most good permanents. Of course, unless you're running a deck that also takes advantage of her abilities when you're *not* raging against the tyranny of Phyrexia, you're going to want to leave her in your sideboard.

posts.post_content:
I love her.
  
It's counter-infect without straight-up removing poison counters, like Wizards promised.
  
I can't really say anything about this card - it's all said on the card, and in present/future comments.
  
Let's face it: she'll see green sideboard.
  
She's cheap, she's useful, and she's flavourfully/functionally beautiful.

Posted By: JFM2796 (8/19/2011 1:52:03 PM)
Rating:

@BastianQoU: No, Melira does prevent the counters from being placed on Etched Monstrosity. I hate quoting rules because I hate sounding like a know-it-all, but this is somewhat important to learn due to Melira's abilities:

121.5. If a spell or ability refers to a counter being “placed” on a permanent, it means putting a counter on that permanent while it’s on the battlefield, or that permanent entering the battlefield with a counter on it.

Somebody get Midnight Banshee on her side, by the way. Those two will do work.

Posted By: TherealphatMatt (4/26/2012 7:04:11 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Let's see...  
-[Phyrexian Hydra](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Hydra) becomes a 7/7 infect for 5cmc [Cho-Manno, Revolutionary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cho-Manno, Revolutionary)  
-If you play this after [Carnifex Demon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Carnifex Demon), your creatures are fine! Just load him up with a [Skinrender](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Skinrender) beforehand  
-[Glistening Oil](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Glistening Oil ) becomes a reusable [phyresis](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=phyresis) w/ no drawback for you, or a slow and torturous reusable removal for your opponents  
-[Black Sun's Zenith](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Black Sun's Zenith) becomes a one sided board sweep  
-Invincibility combo with this and [Phyrexian Unlife](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Unlife) on the board  
-[Phyrexian Vatmother](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Vatmother) and [ichor rats](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=ichor rats) now have no drawback  
-[Etched Monstrosity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Etched Monstrosity) is now a 10/10 for 5cmc w/ no drawback  
-This completely breaks the persist mechanic, not to mention your opponents will be effed if they are playing infect or wither.  
  
I know a lot of this was already mentioned, but I felt like summing up
posts.html:
Let's see...
-Phyrexian Hydra becomes a 7/7 infect for 5cmc Cho-Manno, Revolutionary
-If you play this after Carnifex Demon, your creatures are fine! Just load him up with a Skinrender beforehand
-Glistening Oil becomes a reusable phyresis w/ no drawback for you, or a slow and torturous reusable removal for your opponents
-Black Sun's Zenith becomes a one sided board sweep
-Invincibility combo with this and Phyrexian Unlife on the board
-Phyrexian Vatmother and ichor rats now have no drawback
-Etched Monstrosity is now a 10/10 for 5cmc w/ no drawback
-This completely breaks the persist mechanic, not to mention your opponents will be effed if they are playing infect or wither.

I know a lot of this was already mentioned, but I felt like summing up

posts.post_content:
I find ironic that in my GB persist/undying deck, the one match where I just could not draw Melira was actually against an infect deck. Quite literally, this deck would have been almost entirely shut down if I had just gotten a Melira out... but no.  
  
Of course, this was the same match that saw him have 3 removal spells for my 3 Dark Confidants game 1, then have no removal spells yet have me only get Hex Parasite and 2 Viscera Seers. Some days are just like that I guess.  
  
As for Melira herself though - well, everyone knows by now that she just adores persist.

Posted By: Kirbster (12/14/2012 11:17:35 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Flavor note: Melira is, of course, an anthropomorphic vaccine. She's a hilarious Take That! to the disgraced Andrew Wakefield. (Wakefield had a very Phyrexia-like sense of ethics, having his children recruit test subjects among their schoolyard friends. He also didn't reveal who was funding his research.) While Wakefield thought it was a protein that was his illusory vaccine-autism link; when that failed, he claimed it was ethylmercury (not methylmercury, which acutally does cause brain damage). What resulted was a strident manufactroversy over whether or not vaccines caused autism. (Again, there's no conceivable way they could.)
  
   
Still, she and [Twilight Shepherd](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Twilight Shepherd) make good friends. Or [Unstable Mutation](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unstable Mutation). And she's still a bear, no matter what.
posts.html:

(Wakefield had a very Phyrexia-like sense of ethics, having his children recruit test subjects among their schoolyard friends. He also didn't reveal who was funding his research.) While Wakefield thought it was a protein that was his illusory vaccine-autism link; when that failed, he claimed it was ethylmercury (not methylmercury, which acutally does cause brain damage). What resulted was a strident manufactroversy over whether or not vaccines caused autism. (Again, there's no conceivable way they could.)

Still, she and Twilight Shepherd make good friends. Or Unstable Mutation. And she's still a bear, no matter what.

Posted By: spartanvi (10/11/2012 12:57:50 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I really wish I could make an EDH deck with her as a general, but sadly, I feel like there are just not enough mono green colored/artifact cards which can profit from her, yet...  
  
Best combo I´ve seen so far with her is to use a sac outlet for the [Woodfall Primus](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Woodfall Primus).   
Or the [Witherscale Wurm](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Witherscale Wurm) also has a great synergy with her... Still 2 or 3 more other ways to combo with her as a general, but I just feel like it´s not enough...  
  
IMO, this is a great card, but I think, perhaps it rather should have been a green/black card, instead of just a monogreen card. This way, it would have been twice as nice.   
  
Though, I´m not 100% sure yet, but I think, I could see her fit very well, as a "second general", in a [Savra, Queen of the Golgari](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Savra, Queen of the Golgari) EDH deck...
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Run with [Phyrexian unlife](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian unlife), throw in some fateful hour while you're at it.  
  
They will not lose the "infect" granted from unlife, but you can't get poison counters. Your life is now stuck at 0 (or slightly below) meaning fateful hour is in effect, but you are still (moderately) safe.
